alert.note: Alert for Creek; Okfuskee; Okmulgee; Tulsa (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 5:37PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Creek, northern Okmulgee, south central Tulsa and northwestern Okfuskee Counties through 615 PM CDT... At 537 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 6 miles northwest of Welty, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Bristow... Sapulpa... Glenpool... Kiefer... Beggs... Mounds... Kellyville... Slick... Preston... Bald Hill... Welty... Liberty... Hectorville... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 192 and 194, and between mile markers 211 and 212. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for northeastern and east central Oklahoma.
